intro: Lachemilla barbata, commonly known as the hairy stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features succulent, hairy leaves that are often blue-green in color, adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically white or pale pink, appearing in clusters during the summer months. Lachemilla barbata is well-suited for rock gardens and alpine settings due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
